description: {"blocks":[{"key":"4dc0k","text":"This procedure provides instructions on how to perform a real-time PCR (qPCR) for the detection of Influenza A viruses and avian H5 subtypes from nucleic acid extracted from respiratory samples. This assay targets the avian influenza hemagglutinin (HA) gene of Influenza A subtype H5, primers and probes sequences are updated to enable detection of recent outbreak of Influenza A subtype H5N1. The matrix (M) gene of Influenza A virus is included in this triplex for detection of suspect avian influenza virus (AIV). This assay is not validated and does not contain an endogenous control for the human or avian samples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

funders.funder_name: This study was funded through British Columbia Centre for Disease Control operational funding sources.

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"7t36q","text":"This assay is not validated and does not contain an endogenous control for the human or avian samples. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"63r5c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eu4k7","text":"Nucleic acid extracted from avian samples or patient respiratory samples according to validated procedures using the MagMax Express. All human samples for non-human Influenza A subtyping should be Influenza A positive by another method and be considered non-typable for H3 and pH1N1.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"15lq1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2u9v5","text":"Quality Control:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ifla","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5m48f","text":"A.Positive Extraction Control","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"383tj","text":"Influenza A culture with expected Ct range at Ct 25 - 27 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eqm5b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ftm4a","text":"B.Negative Extraction Control","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4496a","text":"MEM or UltraPure DNase/RNase-Free Distilled water extracted alongside samples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7mjbr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"kfv4","text":"C.Positive PCR control (Synthetic)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ali13","text":"Prepare synthetic control to act as a positive control for hemagglutinin H5, and the matrix gene (all subtypes). Examples can include gBlocks, GeneArt Strings, commerically prepared nucleic acids, or previous positive sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cqa1u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f0j1f","text":"D.Negative PCR control (no template)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"42v5s","text":"UltraPure DNase/RNase-Free Distilled water in PCR mastermix.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
manuscript_citation: {"blocks":[{"key":"428vv","text":"Tracy D. Lee, Frankie Tsang, Kathleen Kolehmainen, Natalie A. Prystajecky, Agatha N. Jassem, John R. Tyson. 2023. A multiplex qRT-PCR assay for detection of Influenza A and H5 subtype targeting new SNPs present in high pathogenicity avian influenza Canadian 2022 outbreak strains. medRxiv 2023.12.13.23298992;  doi: https://doi.org/10.1101/2023.12.13.23298992","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9a9ru","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4j90c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Setting up and Running qPCR on the ABI Quantstudio 7 Pro

steps.section: Setting up and Running qPCR on the ABI Quantstudio 7 Pro
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fdeu7","text":"Remove an Applied Biosystems Fast Optical 96-Well Plate from the box, inside the BSC, and place it in a MicroAmp 96-Well Plate Holder to ensure that the bottom of the plate has no contact with anything that could fluoresce.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f6pd7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5rgif","text":"Note: Do not use permanent marker on optical plates, the ink will fluoresce.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":76},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":6,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Setting up and Running qPCR on the ABI Quantstudio 7 Pro
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ajda4","text":"Aliquot 15µL of each cocktail to the wells being used for the assays in the ABI Fast Optical 96-Well plate. Seal with an adhesive film aseptically.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e26li","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7suhf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dj5tf","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Setting up and Running qPCR on the ABI Quantstudio 7 Pro
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cb9v8","text":"Place the plate in a clean plastic bag and transport it to the genomic preparation room. Place the plate in a MicroAmp 96-Well Plate Holder.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Setting up and Running qPCR on the ABI Quantstudio 7 Pro
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"d24bv","text":"In the genomic room, add 5µL of sample template and controls to the appropriate wells of the 96-well plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Setting up and Running qPCR on the ABI Quantstudio 7 Pro
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"csq8a","text":"Seal the plate with a MicroAmp optical plate film using the plate film applicator.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3k2q2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9f698","text":"Note: Be careful not to contaminate the plate film optical surface with anything that could fluoresce such as ink, dust or fingerprints.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Setting up and Running qPCR on the ABI Quantstudio 7 Pro
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4i2tj","text":"Place the sealed 96-well plate back in the clean plastic bag. Centrifuge in a plate centrifuge and ensure there are no bubbles in the wells before proceeding. Transport the plate to the ABI QuantStudio 7 Pro.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d9edl","text":"","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"djqpr","text":"Note: Centrifugation and transportation in the clean plastic bag prevents contamination with dust prior to loading on the instrument.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":133}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Setting up and Running qPCR on the ABI Quantstudio 7 Pro
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cpj3e","text":"Load the PCR plate into the ABI Quantstudio 7 Pro.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5jhgg","text":"","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7sc61","text":"Remove your plate from the QS 7, place it back in the clean plastic bag, seal, and discard in biohazardous bin.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
